data.title: 15 Private Islands for Sale in The Bahamas
data.meta_description: There are currently 15 islands for sale in The Bahamas. The cheapest Bahamian island is currently available to purchase for $975,000.
data.text:
Latest listing added: December, 2023

Island #1 (SOLD)

Location: Eleuthera

Size: 430 acres

Description: 4km SW of Spanish Wells, Approx 14km NW of North Eleuthera Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Royal Island, located near Russell Island in North Eleuthera, spans 430 acres and includes beautiful beaches, elevated terrain, a natural harbor, and a fully operational private resort, all less than 20 minutes from North Eleuthera’s international airport and FBO. In 2007, it received approvals for a marina and an 18-hole golf course, offering versatile options for a private island retreat.

The current accommodations consist of five luxury one-bedroom beachfront villas with spacious decks, a welcoming center with spa and gym, a restaurant/bar building, and a guest house. All these structures feature expansive verandas overlooking the beaches and an oval-shaped pool. Royal Island is well-suited for private gatherings, offering guests a personalized experience with a top-tier private chef.

Island #2 ($44,500,000)

Location: North Eleuthera

Size: 11 acres

Description: 3km NW of Dunmore Town, 5km NE of North Eleuthera Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Explore lush tropical foliage, uncovering hidden gems like a beach club, bar, and BBQ area. Whether you love water sports or beach relaxation, Crown Pigeon Island offers a serene escape.

It’s a haven for fishermen, with Bonefish flats nearby. For local culture and cuisine, take a short boat ride to Dunmore Town on Harbour Island.

The island features over 12,000 sq. ft. of homes and villas with harbor views, totaling 15 sleeping rooms, patios, gardens, and outdoor kitchens for family gatherings or retreats.

Crown Pigeon Island offers high-speed internet, a water-maker system, composting, and backup generators. A 4-acre harbor with sea turtles, boat lifts, a hauling ramp, and a dock awaits your watercraft.

Island #3 ($35,000,000)

Location: Exuma

Size: 175 acres

Description: 10km from shore, 16km SE of George Town, 13km SE of Exuma Int. Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Hummingbird Cay is a private island paradise located just five miles from the mainland of Great Exuma.

With its crystal-clear waters and ever-changing views of sandbars, reefs, and sky, this magnificent 175-acre jewel is a true wonder of nature. Its 2,500-foot white sandy beach and two smaller beaches offer unparalleled opportunities for fishing, diving, and boating. A private runway is also possible with government approval.

The island boasts a 1,700 sq. ft. main house, three guest houses, utility buildings, and staff accommodation, all powered by off-grid clean solar energy. In addition, there’s a protected small boat harbor, and cellular and internet services are provided by Bahamas Telecommunications Company.

Hummingbird Cay is the ideal spot for a family retreat or a boutique resort, and the Bahamas Government is currently offering enticing investment incentives. Come experience the ultimate in luxury island living at Hummingbird Cay.

Island #4 (SOLD)

Location: Berry Islands

Size: 40 acres

Description: 35km SE of Bullock Harbour, 52km NE of San Andros Airport MYAN

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Little Whale Cay spans more than 40 acres, offering complete privacy and a stunning, gently sloping beach by Little Whale House. The primary accommodation is housed in the two-bedroom principal dwelling, Little Whale House, situated on an elevated bluff with a winding path leading down to the main beach.

In the island’s central elevated position, Peacock House boasts splendid views of the shallow seas to the west. It features a double bedroom suite, a sitting room, a kitchen, and an outdoor terrace. Flamingo House, on the other hand, offers four bedrooms, three with en suite bathrooms, an open-plan sitting room and kitchen, as well as outdoor terraces.

The island also boasts amenities like an all-weather tennis court, an infinity-edge swimming pool, a dining area, and a gym, all affording spectacular sea views. Notably, Little Whale Cay features a 2,230ft runway and a primary private harbor with a 27ft mouth and a 5ft draft at low tide, adjacent to the old schoolhouse and marina stores. There’s also a secondary, smaller harbor and a hard ramp for seaplanes.

Island #5 ($10,000,000)

Location: Exuma

Size: 12 acres

Description: 50km SE of Nassau, 70km SE of Lynden Pindling International Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Roberts Cay is a remarkable private island nestled in the northern Exuma Cays chain. Encompassing 12 acres of vibrant greenery, this idyllic island boasts two pristine white sandy beaches, a sheltered harbor, and an elevation of approximately 32 feet. Surrounded by crystal-clear turquoise waters, it’s a haven for snorkeling in the calm harbor and deep-sea fishing on the eastern side of the Cay.

Situated roughly 28 miles southeast of Nassau, just half a mile south of Ship Channel Cay, and conveniently close to Norman’s and Highbourne Cay, Roberts Cay offers the perfect canvas to craft your own private paradise.

Island #6 ($9,500,000)

Location: Berry Islands

Size: 120 acres

Description: 12km from shore, 68km NW of Nassau, 20km SE of Chub Cay Resort & Marina

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Uninhabited save for sea turtles that frequent the island’s beaches and northern cove, Devil’s Cay is a pristine example of Bahamian splendour.

The property spans 117 acres and is located near the centre of the Berry Islands chain. Having remained undeveloped, the island retains its diversity of habitat and environments – sand shores demarcate much of the property’s perimeter whilst dense vegetation covers the interior. Devils Cay also boasts a minor ridgeline along its western edge.

Devils Cay’s location cannot be undervalued. The Berry Islands have become a serene refuge for many millionaires and real estate investors due to their natural beauty, abundance of aquatic life, and accommodation of leisure activities – residence here enters oneself into one of the world’s most exclusive communities.

Island #7 ($SOLD)

Location: Berry Islands

Size: 24 acres

Description: 65km NW of Nassau, 24km SE of Bullock Harbour

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Sand Dollar Cay is a stunning 24-acre private island in the tranquil Berry Islands of the Bahamas. It offers natural beauty, tranquility, and accessibility. With four pristine white sand beaches and captivating turquoise waters, the island provides a serene escape. Its elevated terrain offers ideal building sites, deepwater access, and safe mooring spots.

The surrounding waters are rich with marine life, perfect for nature lovers, divers, and anglers. Nearby uninhabited islands invite exploration and beachcombing. A world-class marina and a small resort with a 5,000-foot airstrip are just 15 miles away, connecting you to the outside world.

Owning your private island in this tropical paradise fulfills a dream and offers privacy, security, and the opportunity to create a lasting family legacy. Sand Dollar Cay is the ultimate choice for a unique and coveted lifestyle on the Bahamas’ most beautiful private island.

Island #8 ($5,000,000)

Location: Berry Islands

Size: 90 acres

Description: 31km SE of Bullock Harbour, 30km S of Great Harbour Cay-Bullock Harbour Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Wild Berry Cay is an unspoiled gem, nestled near Florida, boasting approximately 90 acres of pristine land with captivating vistas of sandy banks to the west and glistening turquoise waters to the east. The island is graced with several secluded beaches, accessible via some well-defined paths, and features a small structure.

This island has received preliminary approvals for a luxurious glamping resort.

Situated merely 2 miles north of Chub Cay, with its revamped club, marina, and a 5,000-foot airstrip serving as a port of entry, Wild Berry Cay enjoys elevations reaching up to 40 feet. Measuring about 1/2 mile in width and 1 mile in length, it occupies a prime fishing area with rich, fertile soil. Deepwater access is available on the eastern side of the island, while still benefiting from natural protection due to its position set back from the outer oceanfront barrier islands.

Island #9 ($4,950,000)

Location: Eleuthera

Size: 16 acres

Description: 5km N of Dunmore Town, 8km E of Spanish Wells, 84km NE of Nassau

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Pierre Island offers breathtaking 360-degree elevated views of Three Islands Bay, the Atlantic Ocean, Harbour Island, and Eleuthera. This 16-acre private island is the ideal location for a personal estate, just minutes away from Harbour Island. The island boasts the convenience of mainland electricity and water, ensuring a hassle-free island experience.

With well-maintained pathways throughout and a deep-water dock situated on the southern side, Pierre Island showcases lush native vegetation, including 150 coconut trees and abundant birdlife, as well as the foundation for a tennis court. The renowned Harbour Island, with its gourmet restaurants, marinas, and shopping, is a mere 10-minute boat ride away, making this location perfectly situated.

Pierre Island presents an exceptional opportunity for development, whether as a small luxury resort or a grand private island estate, offering all the sophistication and charm of an untouched private island just minutes from the vibrant island playground of Harbour Island.

Island #10 (SOLD)

Location: Exuma

Size: 132 acres

Description: 9km from shore, 225km SE of Nassau, 12km west of George Town

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Tommy Young’s Cay and Arthur McKenzie Cay – another near-unprecedented opportunity to purchase two neighbouring islands in the Bahamian district of Exuma.

The two islands – 122 acres and 10 acres, respectively – are located off the western flank of Great Exuma. This geographic position grants incredible access to the facilities of George Town and the Exuma International Airport.

Both islands are stunning reflections of Caribbean natural beauty. Preserved woodlands cover much of the interior land while soft-sand beaches line their shores. The islands and their surrounding waters are also noted for their wealth and diversity of marine life – here, fishing and diving are commonplace.

Private development on either of these islands would cement their status as tropical havens.

Island #11 ($4,950,000)

Location: Eleuthera

Size: 16 acres

Description: 800m from shore, 5km north of Dunmore Town, 84km NE of Nassau.

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Partially Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Pierre Island is a private haven in waiting. The 16-acre plot of land, located at the northern end of the Eleuthera archipelago, offers a complete roster of desirable features: from stunning Caribbean vistas and an abundance of native wildlife to existing pathways throughout the island and an established utility connection with the mainland. Here, an investor would have the scope to design and build their dream home.

The property is also well connected, with the North Eleuthera Airport being less than 10 kilometres away – a valuable asset for those wanting to divide time between an island retreat and their main residence. Famous Harbour Island with it’s gourmet restaurants, marinas, and shopping is a 10 minute boat ride away.

Island #12 ($3,200,000)

Location: Abaco

Size: 62 acres

Description: 14km S of The Mudd, 11km SE of Leonard M. Thompson International Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Don’t miss this unique chance to own two private islands in the stunning Abaco Islands of the Bahamas: Armstrong and Pond Apple Cays. These pristine islands, spanning 62 acres, offer a tranquil and protected retreat.

With seven picturesque sandy beaches, you’ll have your own private oasis to enjoy powdery white sands, crystal-clear waters, and the Caribbean sun. Plus, the natural boat basin is a dream for boaters, and multiple building sites offer endless possibilities.

Island #13 ($2,500,000)

Location: Exuma

Size: 38 acres

Description: 5km from shore, 9km SW of George Town, 10km south of Exuma Int. Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Nancy Skinner’s Cay is a private island gem located in the stunning Exuma Cays of The Bahamas. Located near Georgetown, the main town on Great Exuma, this island offers both easy access to mainland Exuma and privacy away from the more populated Exuma Cays.

On the north side of the 38-acre cay, the future owners can enjoy an irregular shore and clear shallow waters that run deep with water channels. The south side offers a scenic slope down to a marl and mangrove swash.

For the adventurous, there is a small yet prominent mouth cave that stands 12 feet (3.7 m) above the high-water mark. And if that’s not enough, at the northeast end of the cay lies a bluff where fresh water can be obtained.

An added bonus, shallow water with a deep channel flows along the western portion of this cay and the cays to the south.

Island #14 ($1,995,000)

Location: Eleuthera

Size: 55 acres

Description: 8km from shore, 22km SW of Spanish Wells, 20min boat from Spanish Wells

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Non-developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Like its southern companion (also found on the Bahamian market), North Pimlico Island offers uninhibited access to Eleuthera and its surrounding archipelago.

From this 55-acre property, residents can explore the pink sand beaches of Harbour Island and the surrounding coastlines or spend time relaxing in the secluded serenity of their own private beach. Whatever the motivation may be, ownership of a private island within the Bahamas enters one directly into an exclusive life of tropical luxury.

The island is also noted for its wealth of transport connections and proximity to services. North Eleuthera Airport can be accessed with ease, as can the leisure and residential settlement of Spanish Wells.

Island #15 (Under Contract)

Location: North Eleuthera

Size: 1 Acre

Description: 20m from shore, Approx 2km NE of North Eleuthera Airport

Ownership: Freehold

Development: Developed

Map: See on Google Earth

Also known as Goat Cay or Mrs Bullard Goat Cay, Big Bullard Cay is an undeveloped island located 400 feet off the southwestern shores of Great Exuma – a deepwater channel separates the two bodies of land. Sandy beaches, mangroves, and marl trace the remainder of the island’s border.

Big Bullard’s interior vegetation supports a diverse ecosystem of wildlife, and the surrounding waters are rich with fish and other aquatic creatures.

With enough land for private development and habitat preservation, tropical serenity awaits.
